newsitem.title: CHINA: China blasts U.S. over F-16 sales to Taiwan.
newsitem.headline: China blasts U.S. over F-16 sales to Taiwan.

text.p: China blasted the United States on Wednesday for its sales of F-16 fighters to Taiwan, saying the move had seriously harmed Sino-U.S. relations.
"The Chinese government has already voiced its strong opposition to the U.S. side," Foreign Ministry spokesman Shen Guofang said in a statement.

"Now the U.S. side, in spite of the opposition and representations from the Chinese side, has persisted with conducting its erroneous decision and the Chinese side voices its strong dissatisfaction and resolute opposition," he said.
"(The Chinese side) has made solemn representations to the U.S. side," Shen said.
"(This) has seriously harmed Sino-U.S. relations," he said.
Taiwan took delivery on Tuesday of the first two of 150 F-16s that the island has bought to upgrade its defences.
